intro: Psychotria mollipes, commonly known as the pink psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests. Psychotria mollipes is also noted for its ornamental value and is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
